label: The Table
content:
At The Table on January 23rd, we have the incredible opportunity to hear from Cathy Loerzel and be led in worship by Lindsay Fralick.

Cathy is co-founder of the Allender Center and is co-author, with Dr. Dan Allender, of Redeeming Heartache: How Past Suffering Reveals Our True Calling. We have all experienced heartache of varying kinds. Come hear how God transforms the wounds of our emotional pain and trauma into unlikely guides to living our our deepest calling. Cathy and her husband live in Seattle with their two children, two dogs, and a flock of chickens!


Childcare available by reservation only.

label: How To Engage Another Person’s Story
content:
Most people feel like they don’t know how to engage another person’s story well. They feel inept, clumsy, overwhelmed, and/or they don’t know what to say and what not to say.

Join me and Cathy Loerzel, co-founder of The Allender Center, to learn the art and science behind story work.

It’s one thing to engage your own story; it’s quite another to skillfully engage someone else’s story.

The good news is that engaging another person’s story is a skill that can be learned. To that end, we have put together a conference that will teach you the principles and tactics of effective story engagement—in other words, how to do it.

Saturday, May 13, 2023
8 to 4 PST | 9 to 5 MST
10 to 6 CST | 11 to 7 EST

If you can’t make it on May 13, a video recording of the conference will be available for three months.

This conference is designed for people who want to learn how to engage another person’s story. The other person might be a family member, friend, co-worker, or client. Engaging someone’s story is part art and part science. It can be learned! It is not a magical ability that some people have and some people don’t.

There are certain principles that apply—principles that can be learned—that’s the science part. And then there are techniques that need to be caught by watching others do it—that’s the art part. In this conference, we will teach the principles and techniques of effective story engagement.

label: Redeeming Heartache - Lake Zurich, IL
content:
Redeeming Heartache

Learn More About Redeeming Heartache

February 26, 2022

The Hope Collective

23153 W Miller Rd, Lake Zurich, IL 60047, USA

Map & Directions

Registration

$85

Student & Alumni $55

With 6 CEU's add $50

Register

Learn how heartache of the past can become a springboard for a more hopeful future as you learn to embrace your calling. At the Redeeming Heartache conference, you will gain understanding of why you feel the way you do, and how your coping strategies may be creating a false sense of health. Explore major themes from the new book, Redeeming Heartache, that lead to true connection and healing with ourselves, God, and others.

Get your copy of the book!

With a clear, biblically trustworthy method, Allender and Loerzel walk you through a journey of profound inner transformation–from the shame and hurt of old emotional wounds to true freedom and healing. Drawn from modern research and their pioneering work at The Allender Center, they will help you identify your core trauma in one of the three outcast archetypes–the widow, orphan, or stranger–and chart your path of growth into the God-given roles of priest, prophet, or leader.

Order Redeeming Heartache

Schedule

Saturday, February 26, 2022

9:00am-12:00pm CT

Teaching

12:00pm-1:00pm CT

Lunch Break

1:000pm-4:00pm CT

Teaching

Light refreshments will be provided.

label: StoryWork Weekend with Adam Young
content: Join us for our first StoryWork Weekend in Atlanta, GA this fall. We will work with your story in a small group setting as well as spend time learning about how your family of origin has impacted your daily life.

label: Sacred Interruptions - Fall Harvest Retreat
content:
Join us for our second year of Sacred Interruptions Retreats.


Our vision is a different type of retreat than you may have experienced before. We recognize that there is a space within us of wild and deep knowing that we have worked hard to forget. It is time to welcome that knowing and all it has to tell us about who we are, and who God is, back into our bodies.


We have known the longing for our own bodies to make space for authentic connection, incredible food, and beautiful spaces in which to rest and restore what is empty and weary within us. We have tasted the goodness that comes when we tend those longings.


These weekends offer you just that kind of space. We will combine Bodywork, StoryWork and Ritual as you meet yourself anew, remember what has been lost or forgotten, and encounter the wonder and beauty of God within community. 


Fall Harvest Retreat - October 27-29 - Knoxville, TN

Advent Retreat - December 1-3 - Minneapolis, MN

label: StoryWork Master Class
content:
Develop Advanced Skills For Engaging Trauma Narratives

This event is designed for therapists and lay leaders who are passionate about engaging others’ stories in a redemptive way.

﻿

You will learn how to:

  • Listen to another person’s story well. 
  • Identify the key elements of another person’s story arc. 
  • Name the ways that family of origin dynamics play out in present relationships. 
  • Identify shame, contempt, powerlessness, betrayal, and ambivalence… and understand how each of these is playing out in current life.  
  • Identify when the storyteller is dysregulated and how to engage their dysregulation in a helpful way.
  • Identify arousal structures and understand how they impact a person’s present life. 
  • Utilize core Allender Theory concepts including: narrative theory, how trauma affects the brain, triangulation, complicity, binds, and gaps within story.
  • Listen to your own body as you are engaging another person’s story. 

The overarching purpose of the master class is to pull back the curtain and teach you how Dan, Adam, and Cathy engage story.

label: StoryWork Conference
content:
Uncover the Healing Power of Your Story


This event is designed for anyone who wants the freedom and vitality that comes from engaging one’s own story in a deeper way.

﻿

Our stories shape and influence every dimension of our daily life and relationships. We often focus only on the positive experiences and put the painful ones behind us. Yet when the impact of our stories of wounding and heartache go unaddressed, we find ourselves bound to unhealthy patterns without hope for change.

Connection, presence and joy are possible if we are willing to go back to our origin stories that have deeper meaning and impact than we care to imagine.

By understanding more of your family of origin story, you can tend to the parts of you that were left behind but are now in need of healing and care. 

This conference will help you gain an understanding of how your past story is affecting your present day to day life. It will also invite you to truth-telling, healing lament, and lasting change.


“Our own life is the thing that most influences and shapes our outlook, our tendencies, and our decisions. It is the force that orients us toward the future, and yet we don’t give it a second thought, much less a careful examination. It’s time to listen to our own story.” – Dr. Dan Allender
